group_1.narration: The resurrection of Michiru Kazusa…@This was the method we devised…
Nico’s magic would create a new body,@a clone of Michiru.
While our combined magic would make her an artificial@Magical Girl, effectively giving her life.
And, to bring conscious control over said life, we’d@make use of the Witches’ magnificent life force.
We’d imbue her with the heart of a Witch,@their “cor maleficus”…
By successfully giving her Michiru’s memories,@a perfect clone would be born.
However, the supposedly perfect “Michiru”@didn’t turn out as we expected,@and was considered a failure.
When faced with a Witch,@clones 1 through 12 would lose their senses,@and become unhinged killing machines.
Her late grandma was someone who greatly cherished@her limited days in this world.
Which made us believe that Michiru,@carrying that feeling forward,@didn’t wish to be resurrected…
We’d create life,@and throw it away if it was defective…@The madness of it was something we were aware of.
But still, we could not give up,@and tried one last time…
And the amnesiac number thirteen…@“Kazumi,” was born.
Kazumi brought about change to us all.
Not as Michiru, but as a new existence entirely.
Kazumi’s cries…Kazumi’s tears…everything@brought us face to face with our mistakes.
A lot of things happened,@and we lost many of our friends.@Nico, Saki, and even Juubey were no longer with us.
However, at the end of our many hardships, Kazumi@was given the chance to wish for a miracle.
And so, she became “Kazumi Subaru”…@a real human being.
Kazumi Subaru transferred to our school,@and we started a new life…
Where the three of us gave our best to live@every day in genuine happiness.
Or that’s how it was meant to be…

group_1.textRight: How long are you gonna be ruminating for?
Don’t tell me you forgot who I am.

group_1.textLeft: No…I could never forget you.
You fought for our sake until the very end,@after all.
What the hell happened this past month,@though?
I thought you got destroyed, Juubey.
So tell us…who created you?

group_1.textRight: Clever as ever, that’s the Umika I know.
Still though, the one who made me, Umika...
...was you.

group_1.textLeft: I made…this Juubey?

group_1.textRight: More accurately, it was “yours” and “Kaoru’s”@combined magic, that is.

group_1.textLeft: I don’t remember doing any of that.

group_1.textRight: I figured as much.
The ones that made me…were just like@Saki and Nico.
They were “copies” of you two.

group_1.textLeft: Copies…?!
There’s even copies of us too?!

group_1.textRight: For a small…but very important wish,@the two copies...
...became Magical Girl Umika and@Magical Girl Kaoru.
The two of them worked too hard, and realized@their Gems were at their limit.
But they hadn’t made their important wish@come true yet.
So, hoping for the real ones to take over,
they entrusted me to contact you two.

group_1.textLeft: Why did our copies want to leave their wish@in our hands?

group_1.textRight: It’s because they shared their wish…
...with you two as well, I’m sure.

group_1.textLeft: A wish we have…?

group_1.textRight: It’s a long story, but you have to listen.@This is where the main issue starts.
A copy of the Pleiades Saints…@And also, Michiru…
So that plan was set in motion while we@weren’t here.

group_1.textLeft: And as Juubey says…
There’s also “a wish we have” as well.
Besides…that Michiru hasn’t escaped from@her despair yet.

group_1.textRight: That’s exactly why your copies wanted to@entrust this to you.

group_1.textLeft: What interests me, though…is the@“borderlines” of “those girls.”

group_1.textRight: What “borderlines”…?

group_1.textLeft: In order to fulfill their novel “plan” that@they started for themselves…
They made copies of us, the originals.
However, unless they abandon their own@identities,
their plan won’t be able to proceed.

group_1.textRight: But, the Saki we just met…
She was exactly like the real Saki.

group_1.textLeft: Indeed.
The borderline between their own identities and@their memories as copies is getting blurry.
If that continues, their minds will become@unstable.
That might result in serious consequences@for their Gems.

group_1.textRight: By proxy, the “Magical Girl Hunting”@that Saki started,
being unrelated to their plan overall…
It might be a consequence of the blurring@boundaries.

group_1.textLeft: We don’t have a lot of time, it seems.@Let’s hurry.
For Michiru…and Kazumi.

group_1.textRight: And for our copies,@who left the rest in our hands.
Hehe…how nostalgic!

group_1.textLeft: So, they made another Juubey.
“Umika” and “Kaoru” were quite bold.

group_1.textRight: The counterfeit money dilemma, huh.

group_1.textLeft: Hm…?

group_1.textRight: If a counterfeit note is indistinguishable@from the real deal,
it's not really a counterfeit then,@or something like that.
…In other words,@the best falsification is the real thing.

group_1.textLeft: Oh, I get it.
Then we shall give the defectors’ roles...
...to the real Umika and Kaoru.
And now, what we need to succeed in our plan…
Michiru, it’s your decision.
